sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>old</radical> <radical>moon</radical> (the moon we had before the current moon) was actually just a huge <kanji>barbarian</kanji> floating in the sky.
meaningInfo: Just imagine a huge barbarian (whatever that means to you) floating in the sky, looking down. Some ancient people look up and wave at the old moon barbarian.
readingMnemonic: At least, this is the kind of story you told your <ja><reading>子</reading></ja> (<ja>こ</ja>) when they asked you where the moon came from.
readingInfo: "You see, my child, the old moon was not like the current moon. It was a giant barbarian in the sky, who would eat children that asked too many questions."
